lines.text: You don't make up for your sins in church. You do it in the streets. You do it at home. The rest is bullshit and you know it.
[They all raise their glasses to The Queen]
You know what the Queen said? If I had balls, I'd be King.

It's all bullshit except the pain. The pain of hell. The burn from a lighted match increased a million times. Infinite. Now, ya don't fuck around with the infinite. There's no way you do that. The pain in hell has two sides. The kind you can touch with your hand; the kind you can feel in your heart... your soul, the spiritual side. And ya know... the worst of the two is the spiritual.
a jerk-off. You're a fucking jerk-off! You're laughing 'cause you're a jerk-off. I'll tell 'ya something else,
[lights ten dollar bill on fire]
I fuck you right where you breath, because I don't give two shits about you or nobody else.
[Michael jumps at Johnny Boy and they both fight but Charlie breaks them up, Johnny Boy pulls out a gun]
Come on... Come on... fuck face! Come on... 'ya motherfucker! Motherfucker!... come on! I got somethin' for 'ya asshole!
You don't- you don't have the guts to use that.
Oh, I don't have the guts, huh? Come over here, I'll shove this up yer ass! Come on!
[Michael leaves]
Hey asshole, this is for you asshole! He's a fucking asshole!
[laughs]
I fuck you right where you breathe.
[referring to his epileptic cousin Teresa]
I always wondered what happens when she comes. Does she have a fit?

[the cops have broken up the fight, taken a bribe, and left the bar]
This is the drink we never had before.
Hey, why don't you lower the jukebox, I can't hear nothin'.
Hey, the girls like the music loud.
Girls. You call those skanks girls?

[to Charlie]
Hey, what's a matter with this kid, huh?
Hey, there ain't nothin' wrong with me my friend, I'm feelin' fine.
Keep your mouth shut.
You tell me that in front of this asshole?
Alright, alright, we're not gonna pay. We're not paying.
But why? Joey, we just said we were gonna have a drink.

[Joey interupts]
We're not payin', because this guy, this guy's a fuckin' mook.
But I didn't say nothin'.
And we don't pay mooks.
Mook? I'm a mook?
Yeah
What's a mook?
A mook, what's a mook?
I don't know...
What's a mook?
You can't call me a mook!
I can't?
No...

[pause]
I'll give you mook!
[punches Jimmy in the face]
a jerk-off.
[Johnny Boy is pointing his .38 at Michael]
You don't have the guts to use that.
I don't, huh? I don't have the guts? Come here, asshole. Come over here. I'll put this up your ass.
Hey, sorry lady! I'm sorry! I hate that lady with a passion... with a vengeance.

You know something? She is really good-lookin'. I gotta say that again. She is really good-lookin'. But she's black. You can see that real plain, right? Look, there isn't much of a difference anyway, is there. Well, is there?

[showing a picture of his new girlfriend]
You think she's good-looking? She's smart, too. She's gonna be a teacher.
Let me see that. Oh, I know this girl.
Yeah?
Yeah... I saw her kissing a nigger under a bridge.
What? What do you mean?
A nigger. As in black. A nigger.
But what do you mean?

[rolls his eyes]
I mean... kissing. Her lips on his lips. Kissing.

[worried]
I kissed her.
Honorable men go with honorable men.
What's the matter, you too good for this ten dollars? Huh? You too good for it? It's a good ten dollars. Know somethin' Mikey? You make me laugh. You know that?
Twenty dollars! Let's go da movies!
Y'know Joey Clams...
Yeah.
...Joey Scallops, yeah.
I know him too, yeah.
...yeah. No. No, Joey Scallops is Joey Clams.
Right.
Right.
...they're the same person!
Yeah!
'ey!
Stay out of my place, I know your face!
[repeated line]
What's the matter with you?
I learned this from Charley Lucky during the World War II.
Oh? What did he do?
What did he do? He was there, that's what he did.

[Charlie hits him]
You two-faced, dirty fucking bastard! Don't you ever hit me again!

This Johnny Boy is like your mister Groppi... a little crazy. It's nice you should help him out because of his family and our family but watch yourself... Don't spoil anything. His whole family has problems... his cousin, the girl who lives next door to you...
Teresa.
...The one who's sick, right? In the head.
No, she's got epilepsy.
Yeah. That's what I said, sick in the head.
Look Charlie, you're a good boy. Will you just tell your uncle that I have nothing. There is nothing to give him. No envelopes with cash inside, no checks, nothing.
That bad, huh?
I can't make this week's payment and if this keeps up not next week's either.
Not next week's either... listen... you tell that to Giovanni, not me.
Listen, I should wrap up this place in a ribbon and hand it to him, you know that. I don't need this aggravation. I'm getting old.
He'd rather have the loan payed, you know that.
Look... I'll give ya $20 to hold ya for now.
What, are ya kidding? $20 doesn't pay the interest for 2 hours. Now, with a vig, it's almost $3000.
$3000? Shit, you charge a guy from the neighborhood $1800 vig? One day he's late with his payments.
Whatta ya think I am, his father?
